title: Extended Pop-Up Experience
credits: As part of Random Studio for Rimowa
lede: Envisioning new opportunities for omni-channel experiences by turning limited product stock into a unique retail discovery.

text.heading: Insight
text.text: When approaching the experience concept for a series of Rimowa pop-up stores, we aimed to design a form language that allows each interior element and digital touchpoint to be combined in various configurations, catering to any spatial needs.

text.heading: Idea
text.text: Viewing space limits and low product stock as opportunities, our team aspired to create a space that seamlessly blends e-commerce with a physical store.

text.heading: End Result
text.text: Inside, we provide interactive tools for discovery and information. Through intuitive interfaces, that are controlled with physical products, digital displays reveal other colourways, sizes and insights.

ENGAGE
An interactive window display  gives an inviting and unobscured view into the pop up and engages shoppers who walk by in playful yet elegant way.

EXTENDED EXPLORATION
Shoppers can extend their exploration of sizes, colours and styles using Digital Twin objects while still having the physical product present.
Shopper can immediately explore the physical collection (which is most natural behaviour). If the shopper has clear intent for a specific item(s) they immediately continue to the check-out desk.

FINALISE AND CHECK-OUT
The check-out desk is set up as a more private moment where customer can complete their selection and confirm their order.
